intro: Monadenium letestuanum, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is known for its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds, and is often found in dry, sandy habitats. Monadenium letestuanum is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
